title: Gloves
data:
**[English]()** • [中文（中国大陆）‎](/wiki/Gloves/zh-CN "Gloves/zh-CN")

**Gloves** are one portion of a player's [armor](/wiki/Armor "Armor"). They provide a small bonus to [armor class](/wiki/Armor_class "Armor class"), and can be [enchanted](/wiki/Scroll_of_enchant_armor "Scroll of enchant armor") further reducing your armor class. Furthermore, all gloves protect the player from the [stoning](/wiki/Stoning "Stoning") effects of touching [cockatrice](/wiki/Cockatrice "Cockatrice") corpses.

## Types

They come in four forms: simple [leather gloves](/wiki/Leather_gloves "Leather gloves") (yugake), [gauntlets of power](/wiki/Gauntlets_of_power "Gauntlets of power") (often abbreviated *GoP*), [gauntlets of dexterity](/wiki/Gauntlets_of_dexterity "Gauntlets of dexterity") (*GoD*), and [gauntlets of fumbling](/wiki/Gauntlets_of_fumbling "Gauntlets of fumbling") (*GoF*):

| Name                                                                            | [Cost](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid") | [Weight](/wiki/Weight "Weight") | [AC](/wiki/Armor_Class "Armor Class") | [Material](/wiki/Material "Material") | Effect                                                                                                     |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------- | ------------------------------- | ------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [Gauntlets of dexterity](/wiki/Gauntlets_of_dexterity "Gauntlets of dexterity") | 50                              | 10                              | 1                                     | [Leather](/wiki/Leather "Leather")    | [Dexterity](/wiki/Dexterity "Dexterity") bonus (+/− [enchantment](/wiki/Enchantment "Enchantment"))        |
| [Gauntlets of fumbling](/wiki/Gauntlets_of_fumbling "Gauntlets of fumbling")    | 50                              | 10                              | 1                                     | [Leather](/wiki/Leather "Leather")    | [Fumbling](/wiki/Fumbling "Fumbling"), usually generated [cursed](/wiki/Cursed "Cursed")                   |
| [Gauntlets of power](/wiki/Gauntlets_of_power "Gauntlets of power")             | 50                              | 30                              | 1                                     | [Iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron")             | [Strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength") 25, interfere with [spellcasting](/wiki/Spellcasting "Spellcasting") |
| [Leather gloves](/wiki/Leather_gloves "Leather gloves")                         | 8                               | 10                              | 1                                     | [Leather](/wiki/Leather "Leather")    | None                                                                                                       |

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

As of [this commit](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/67295bc706525934c461a0d940ca0da39fc302d2), wearing non-metallic gloves (all but gauntlets of power) will protect worn [rings](/wiki/Ring "Ring") from electrical damage.

Wearing a [cursed](/wiki/Cursed "Cursed") pair of gloves prevents you from putting on or removing any [rings](/wiki/Rings "Rings"). However, if you are wearing an [uncursed](/wiki/Uncursed "Uncursed") pair of gloves, you can still put on or remove rings without removing your gloves, and wearing gloves does not increase the number of in-game turns required to switch rings.

Gloves can be generated with the following appearances: old gloves, padded gloves, riding gloves, fencing gloves.

## Strategy

Gauntlets of power are the best choice for most characters. Even though they inhibit spellcasting, roles like [Wizard](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard"), [Priest](/wiki/Priest "Priest"), or [Monk](/wiki/Monk "Monk") are often able to cast spells anyway, and benefit significantly from the damage boost and increased carrying capacity. Valkyries can throw [Mjollnir](/wiki/Mjollnir "Mjollnir") when wearing gauntlets of power. However, they are somewhat rare, and often not worth considering for a wish over other [ascension kit](/wiki/Ascension_kit "Ascension kit") items.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Gauntlets of power being metal, and thus lacking protection of worn rings from electrical damage, may change the above.

Gauntlets of dexterity are somewhat less useful, since [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") is rarely an issue, especially after obtaining a [luckstone](/wiki/Luckstone "Luckstone"). The exceptions are attacks that do not involve luck, such as throwing a [potion](/wiki/Potion "Potion") or casting [magic missile](/wiki/Spellbook_of_magic_missile "Spellbook of magic missile") at a monster. Min-maxed [human](/wiki/Human_\(starting_race\) "Human (starting race)") or [dwarf](/wiki/Dwarf_\(starting_race\) "Dwarf (starting race)") characters with 18/\*\* [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength") would receive almost no benefits from gauntlets of power, and would favor gauntlets of dexterity when putting together an [ascension kit](/wiki/Ascension_kit "Ascension kit"), though this rarely occurs in practice.

Leather gloves have no special properties but do not inhibit spellcasting and are perfectly suitable for an ascension kit. They are readily available from [watchmen](/wiki/Watchmen "Watchmen") or members of the [Yendorian Army](/wiki/Yendorian_Army "Yendorian Army").

Since [fumbling](/wiki/Fumbling "Fumbling") is fairly crippling, putting on unknown magical gloves without [curse testing](/wiki/Curse_testing "Curse testing") is ill-advised.

## SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") adds one new pair of gloves, the [gauntlets of swimming](/wiki/Gauntlets_of_swimming "Gauntlets of swimming"), and *black gloves* as a new possible randomized appearance for all types of magical gloves. SLASH'EM also adds [the Gauntlets of Defense](/wiki/The_Gauntlets_of_Defense "The Gauntlets of Defense"), a [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral") pair of artifact [gauntlets of dexterity](/wiki/Gauntlets_of_dexterity "Gauntlets of dexterity") that are the guaranteed first sacrifice gift for a [Monk](/wiki/Monk "Monk").

SLASH'EM additionally changes the behavior of [gauntlets of power](/wiki/Gauntlets_of_power "Gauntlets of power"); instead of automatically increasing your strength to 25, your strength is set to 18/\*\* if it was lower, and then increased by the enchantment of the gloves, much like gauntlets of dexterity. [Valkyries](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie") alone are able to safely enchant the gauntlets of power to +7, while other roles are limited to +5; thus only Valkyries can reliably obtain 25 strength through the gauntlets of power.

SLASH'EM does not change the effect of gauntlets of dexterity directly, but since dexterity bonuses will also decrease [AC](/wiki/AC "AC"), a highly enchanted pair of gauntlets of dexterity will greatly decrease your AC once your race's maximum dexterity is reached.

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.6. Click here for more information.](/images/5/57/Nh366-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.6. Click here for more information.")
html:
Gloves

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 中文（中国大陆）‎

Gloves are one portion of a player's armor. They provide a small bonus to armor class, and can be enchanted further reducing your armor class. Furthermore, all gloves protect the player from the stoning effects of touching cockatrice corpses.

Types

They come in four forms: simple leather gloves (yugake), gauntlets of power (often abbreviated GoP), gauntlets of dexterity (GoD), and gauntlets of fumbling (GoF):

Name Cost Weight AC Material Effect
Gauntlets of dexterity 50 10 1 Leather Dexterity bonus (+/− enchantment)
Gauntlets of fumbling 50 10 1 Leather Fumbling, usually generated cursed
Gauntlets of power 50 30 1 Iron Strength 25, interfere with spellcasting
Leather gloves 8 10 1 Leather None

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

As of this commit, wearing non-metallic gloves (all but gauntlets of power) will protect worn rings from electrical damage.

Wearing a cursed pair of gloves prevents you from putting on or removing any rings. However, if you are wearing an uncursed pair of gloves, you can still put on or remove rings without removing your gloves, and wearing gloves does not increase the number of in-game turns required to switch rings.

Gloves can be generated with the following appearances: old gloves, padded gloves, riding gloves, fencing gloves.

Strategy

Gauntlets of power are the best choice for most characters. Even though they inhibit spellcasting, roles like Wizard, Priest, or Monk are often able to cast spells anyway, and benefit significantly from the damage boost and increased carrying capacity. Valkyries can throw Mjollnir when wearing gauntlets of power. However, they are somewhat rare, and often not worth considering for a wish over other ascension kit items.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Gauntlets of power being metal, and thus lacking protection of worn rings from electrical damage, may change the above.

Gauntlets of dexterity are somewhat less useful, since to-hit is rarely an issue, especially after obtaining a luckstone. The exceptions are attacks that do not involve luck, such as throwing a potion or casting magic missile at a monster. Min-maxed human or dwarf characters with 18/** strength would receive almost no benefits from gauntlets of power, and would favor gauntlets of dexterity when putting together an ascension kit, though this rarely occurs in practice.

Leather gloves have no special properties but do not inhibit spellcasting and are perfectly suitable for an ascension kit. They are readily available from watchmen or members of the Yendorian Army.

Since fumbling is fairly crippling, putting on unknown magical gloves without curse testing is ill-advised.

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM adds one new pair of gloves, the gauntlets of swimming, and black gloves as a new possible randomized appearance for all types of magical gloves. SLASH'EM also adds the Gauntlets of Defense, a neutral pair of artifact gauntlets of dexterity that are the guaranteed first sacrifice gift for a Monk.

SLASH'EM additionally changes the behavior of gauntlets of power; instead of automatically increasing your strength to 25, your strength is set to 18/** if it was lower, and then increased by the enchantment of the gloves, much like gauntlets of dexterity. Valkyries alone are able to safely enchant the gauntlets of power to +7, while other roles are limited to +5; thus only Valkyries can reliably obtain 25 strength through the gauntlets of power.

SLASH'EM does not change the effect of gauntlets of dexterity directly, but since dexterity bonuses will also decrease AC, a highly enchanted pair of gauntlets of dexterity will greatly decrease your AC once your race's maximum dexterity is reached.

Retrieved from "https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Gloves&oldid=169560"

'''Gloves''' are one portion of a player's [[armor]].
They provide a small bonus to [[armor class]], and can be [[scroll of enchant armor | enchanted]] further reducing your armor class.
Furthermore, all gloves protect the player from the [[stoning]] effects of touching [[cockatrice]] corpses.

== Types ==
They come in four forms: simple [[leather gloves]] (yugake), [[gauntlets of power]] (often abbreviated ''GoP''), [[gauntlets of dexterity]] (''GoD''), and [[gauntlets of fumbling]] (''GoF''):

{{upcoming|NetHack 3.7.0|As of {{commit|67295bc706525934c461a0d940ca0da39fc302d2|this commit}}, wearing non-metallic gloves (all but gauntlets of power) will protect worn [[ring]]s from electrical damage.}}

Wearing a [[cursed]] pair of gloves prevents you from putting on or removing any [[rings]]. However, if you are wearing an [[uncursed]] pair of gloves, you can still put on or remove rings without removing your gloves, and wearing gloves does not increase the number of in-game turns required to switch rings.

Gloves can be generated with the following appearances: old gloves, padded gloves, riding gloves, fencing gloves.

== Strategy ==
Gauntlets of power are the best choice for most characters. Even though they inhibit spellcasting, roles like [[Wizard]], [[Priest]], or [[Monk]] are often able to cast spells anyway, and benefit significantly from the damage boost and increased carrying capacity. Valkyries can throw [[Mjollnir]] when wearing gauntlets of power. However, they are somewhat rare, and often not worth considering for a wish over other [[ascension kit]] items.

{{upcoming|NetHack 3.7.0|Gauntlets of power being metal, and thus lacking protection of worn rings from electrical damage, may change the above.}}

Gauntlets of dexterity are somewhat less useful, since [[to-hit]] is rarely an issue, especially after obtaining a [[luckstone]]. The exceptions are attacks that do not involve luck, such as throwing a [[potion]] or casting {{spell of|magic missile}} at a monster. Min-maxed [[Human (starting race)|human]] or [[Dwarf (starting race)|dwarf]] characters with 18/** [[strength]] would receive almost no benefits from gauntlets of power, and would favor gauntlets of dexterity when putting together an [[ascension kit]], though this rarely occurs in practice. 

Leather gloves have no special properties but do not inhibit spellcasting and are perfectly suitable for an ascension kit. They are readily available from [[watchmen]] or members of the [[Yendorian Army]].

Since [[fumbling]] is fairly crippling, putting on unknown magical gloves without [[curse testing]] is ill-advised.

== SLASH'EM ==
[[SLASH'EM]] adds one new pair of gloves, the [[gauntlets of swimming]], and ''black gloves'' as a new possible randomized appearance for all types of magical gloves. SLASH'EM also adds [[the Gauntlets of Defense]], a [[neutral]] pair of artifact [[gauntlets of dexterity]] that are the guaranteed first sacrifice gift for a [[Monk]].

SLASH'EM additionally changes the behavior of [[gauntlets of power]]; instead of automatically increasing your strength to 25, your strength is set to 18/** if it was lower, and then increased by the enchantment of the gloves, much like gauntlets of dexterity. [[Valkyrie]]s alone are able to safely enchant the gauntlets of power to +7, while other roles are limited to +5; thus only Valkyries can reliably obtain 25 strength through the gauntlets of power.

SLASH'EM does not change the effect of gauntlets of dexterity directly, but since dexterity bonuses will also decrease [[AC]], a highly enchanted pair of gauntlets of dexterity will greatly decrease your AC once your race's maximum dexterity is reached.
